alert.note: Alert for Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 12 at 12:50PM MST until February 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Montana, Southern Big Horn. In Wyoming, Sheridan Foothills. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially over southern portions of Sheridan County. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
